results.title: The Potential Therapeutic Application of Simvastatin for Brain Complications and Mechanisms of Action
results.text_hl: Recent studies have suggested that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ could be a promising therapeutic option for different @DISEASE_Brain_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001927 @@@brain complications@@@ and diseases ranging from @DISEASE_Brain_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D001932 @@@brain tumors@@@ (i.e., @DISEASE_Medulloblastoma @DISEASE_MESH:D008527 @@@medulloblastoma@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Glioblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@glioblastoma@@@) to @DISEASE_Neurologic_Manifestations @DISEASE_MESH:D009461 @@@neurological disorders@@@ (i.e., @DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@Alzheimer's disease@@@, @DISEASE_Parkinson_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D010300 @@@Parkinson's disease@@@, and @DISEASE_Huntington_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D006816 @@@Huntington's disease@@@).

citations.NLM: Vuu YM, Kadar Shahib A, Rastegar M. The Potential Therapeutic Application of Simvastatin for Brain Complications and Mechanisms of Action Pharmaceuticals (Basel). 2023 Jun 22;16(7):. PMID: 37513826
citations.BibTeX: @article{37513826, title={The Potential Therapeutic Application of Simvastatin for Brain Complications and Mechanisms of Action}, author={Vuu YM and Kadar Shahib A and Rastegar M}, journal={Pharmaceuticals (Basel)}, volume={16}, number={7}}

results.title: Inverse screening of Simvastatin kinase targets from glioblastoma druggable kinome.
results.text_hl: It is revealed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ can potentially interact with certain known targets or key regulators of @<m>DISEASE_Glioblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@GBM@@@ such as @GENE_EGFR @GENE_1956 @@@ErbB@@@, @GENE_SRC @GENE_6714 @@@c-Src@@@ and FGFR signaling pathways, but exhibit low affinity to the well-established @<m>DISEASE_Glioblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@GBM@@@ target of PI3K/@GENE_AKT1 @GENE_207 @@@Akt@@@/@GENE_MTOR @GENE_2475 @@@mTOR@@@ pathway.

citations.NLM: Li Y, Wei X, Wang Q, Li W, Yang T. Inverse screening of Simvastatin kinase targets from glioblastoma druggable kinome. Comput Biol Chem. 2020 Jun;86():107243. PMID: 32172201
citations.BibTeX: @article{32172201, title={Inverse screening of Simvastatin kinase targets from glioblastoma druggable kinome.}, author={Li Y and Wei X and Wang Q and Li W and Yang T}, journal={Comput Biol Chem}, volume={86}, pages={107243}}

results.title: Simvastatin increases temozolomide-induced cell death by targeting the fusion of autophagosomes and lysosomes.
results.text_hl: In this study, we investigated the potentiation of @CHEMICAL_Temozolomide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077204 @@@TMZ@@@-induced apoptosis by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simva@@@) in @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Glioblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@GBM@@@ cell lines and @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Glioblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@GBM@@@ cells, using cell monolayers and three-dimensional cell culture systems.

results.title: Synthesis of Biotinylated PAMAM G3 Dendrimers Substituted with R-Glycidol and Celecoxib/Simvastatin as Repurposed Drugs and Evaluation of Their Increased Additive Cytotoxicity for Cancer Cell Lines
results.text_hl: Despite this, it may be concluded that biotinylated and R-glycidylated PAMAM G3 @CHEMICAL_Dendrimers @CHEMICAL_MESH:D050091 @@@dendrimers@@@ substituted with both @CHEMICAL_Celecoxib @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068579 @@@celecoxib@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ can be considered as a new perspective anticancer agent, effective in therapy of malignant, incurable @<m>DISEASE_Glioblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@glioblastomas@@@.

results.title: Preparation and Characterization of Simvastatin Nanocapsules: Encapsulation of Hydrophobic Drugs in Calcium Alginate.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ belongs to a group of @CHEMICAL_Mevalonic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008798 @@@mevalonate@@@ cascade inhibitors (statins) which have recently been considered as a possible new approach in @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ treatment especially @<m>DISEASE_Glioblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@glioblastoma@@@.

results.title: Nose-to-brain delivery of simvastatin mediated by chitosan-coated lipid-core nanocapsules allows for the treatment of glioblastoma in vivo.
results.text_hl: Despite @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SVT@@@) showing potential anticancer properties, its antitumoral effect against @<m>DISEASE_Glioblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@glioblastoma@@@ appears limited when the conventional oral administration route is selected.

results.title: HMG-CoA reductase inhibition causes increased necrosis and apoptosis in an in vivo mouse glioblastoma multiforme model.
results.text_hl: MATERIALS AND METHODS: An orthotopic @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Glioblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@glioblastoma@@@ (@CELLLINE_CVCL:8806 @@@GL-26@@@) model was used to investigate the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Glioblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005909 @@@glioblastoma@@@ vasculature in vivo.
